item.title: Fallout 3 - Broken Steel Debut Trailer
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Gom _Jabbar:

Foolishly bought on the ps3, dam xbox exsulivity. cant wait till I can get my pc up to spec and play it on that

Personally im more excited by the anounced vagas project being headed up by the people who led fallout to its original greatness like Chris Avallone.

Yeah, I hope they bring back traits. Or at least have a downside to some of the perks. By the end of the game, you were an unstoppable being. An appearence of the NCR would be cool too.
Oh! And prostitutes! I want my own Casino and get digital blowjobs all damn day for my evil character! Which leads me to my next point: bring back Reputations! Specifically, the Pornstar reputation! Can’t wait to get that in Fallout 2!

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3 - Broken Steel Debut Trailer
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
Good news everyone!

[COLOR=‘White’]Broken Steel alters the ending of the original Fallout 3 to allow continued play after the end of the main quest line. This means that when it is time to go into the reactor at the end of Take it Back!, you can still go in yourself or you can send one of three side characters. However, even if you go yourself, you do not die. Instead, you survive the ordeal and wake up two weeks later at the Citadel. If you allow the Purifier to explode, the game will still end.

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3 - Broken Steel Debut Trailer
item.dc:creator: John_Killer118
item.description:
Downloading now! Not the trailer, the actual DLC! I haven’t finished the game yet (About three main-quest away) but I still want the SWEET SWEET XP!
Operation: Anchorage sucked hard. It would of been a nice diversion if you could just replay it (maybe if you have a high-enoigh sciece skill you can make the computers run on auto-pilot or somthing.) The Pitt however, was awesome! Raising the Level Cap to 30 and removing the game’s ending makes Broken Steel an auto-win!

Read full topic

item.title: Fallout 3 - Broken Steel Debut Trailer
item.dc:creator: Spooks
item.description:
Well it was announced not long ago but the trailer did come out today if I’m not mistaken.

I’ve yet to finish the game, but I was really disappointed to hear that you can’t explore after you finish the main quest. That and, well, the people complaining how awful the ending actually was. I’m quite happy for the increased level cap and reworked ending, if that’s what they did.

So, uum, yay?

Read full topic
